meanings.definition: The act of removing someone from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The deposal of the king led to a new ruler taking over.
meanings.sent2: After the deposal of the corrupt leader, the country experienced positive changes.
meanings.sent3: The deposal of the principal for a day made the students excited for the substitute.
meanings.sent4: Her deposal of the old ways opened up new opportunities for growth.
meanings.sent5: The deposal of the dictator was celebrated by the citizens with cheers and banners.

meanings.definition: The act of depositing something, especially money, in a bank or other financial institution.
meanings.sent1: I made a deposal of my savings into the bank account.
meanings.sent2: The deposal of the cash into the ATM was quick and convenient.
meanings.sent3: His deposal of loose change into the piggy bank made a satisfying clinking sound.
meanings.sent4: The deposal of the donation into the charity box warmed her heart.
meanings.sent5: The deposal of the gold bars into the vault was done with utmost care.
